Cell* Frame::look_up ( std::string  name  ) 

Look up the value bound to the name from current frame and its parent frame along to the global frame. (error if no value bound to the name).

Returns:
the Cell bound to the name.

Frame * Frame::make_new_frame ( Cell *  formals,
Cell *  args 
)

Make a new frame for calling user defined function, bind all arguments to the formal parameters in the new frame. (error if the number of args doesn't equal to number of formals).

Returns:
Pointer to the new frame.

If formals is a symbol, then the function accept arbitrary number of arguments. Simply bind the arg list to the parameter.

First check if the number of arguments given matches the number of formal parameter required by formals.

Make a new frame whose parent is this frame. Bind values in args to corresponding parameters in formals.
